required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Respiratory Muscle in Patient With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Primary and Accessory Respiratory Muscles and Their Influence on Exercise Capacity and Dyspnea in Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is that evaluation of basic and accessory respiratory muscles and their relationship of six minute walk test in patient with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH)

primary_outcome.description: pectoralis muscle strength will be evaluated with hand held dynamometers according to muscle test technique
Serratus anterior muscle strength will be evaluated with hand held dynamometers according to muscle test technique
sternocleidomasteoideus muscle strength will be evaluated with hand held dynamometers according to muscle test technique
Respiratory mouth pressure will be measured to determine maximally inspiratory pressure and maximally expiratory pressure according to ATS/ERS guidelines.

secondary_outcome.description: Six minute walk test will be performed to evalute functionally exercise capacity according to ATS/ERS guidelines
London Chest Activity of Daily Living Scale will be used to sensation of dyspne during activity of daily living.

arm_group.description: Maximal mouth pressure will be evaluated for determine respiratory muscle strength, m. pectoralis, m. serratus anterior, m. sternocloideumasteoideus and quadriceps muscles strengths will be measured to evaluate accessory respiratory muscle strength, London chest activity of daily living scale will be done for assessment of dyspnea and six minute walk test will be used for determination of functionally capacity

Maximal mouth pressure will be evaluated for determine respiratory muscle strength, m. pectoralis, m. serratus anterior, m. sternocloideumasteoideus and quadriceps muscles strengths will be measured to evaluate accessory respiratory muscle strength, London chest activity of daily living scale will be done for assessment of dyspnea and six minute walk test will be used for determination of functionally capacity

intervention.description: subjective and objective measurement will be performed in patients with PAH

study_pop.textblock: patient group will be chosen among the admitted to clinic control group will consist of invited volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with diagnosis of pulmonary arterial hypertension
- patients with stabil drug therapy at least three months
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with obstructive and/ or restrictive lung disease comorbidity
- severe orthopedic and/ or neurological comorbidity
- patients with severe heart failure
- patients with severe ischemic heart disease
- uncooperative patients
